The hotel in question is part of the Marriott chain, however, the level of service provided did not meet the expected professional hospitality standards. The check-in process was unnecessarily lengthy, taking approximately 30 minutes, and a deposit was required as per hotel policy. Upon arrival at the hotel at 4:30 PM, only one of the two booked rooms was available, despite the standard check-in time being 3 PM. The other room was not ready for occupancy until 5:45 PM. This is unacceptable and no valid explanation was offered. Furthermore, the Bonvoy membership benefits were not honored during our stay. There was no priority lane for check-in, no offering for late check-out (need to ask) and no welcome drink was provided in the room, and the breakfast is full in the morning but the server doesnt care to help fo find the table for guest. In order to maintain the Marriott brand's reputation and ensure customer loyalty, significant improvements in the hotel's service standards are necessary. Hospitality should be the cornerstone of the hotel's operations, and loyalty programs should provide tangible benefits to members. On a positive note, the hotel's location in the city center is advantageous. We hope that this constructive feedback will lead to improvements in the hospitality services offered during our next visit.
